body.p:
Carlisle, Ky,
March 22, 1861,
Hon B. Magoffin,

Mr William Ricketts of this county will apply to you, to be released from a judgment rendered against him as surety for his son on a recognizance bond, and which judgment was rendered at the present term of the Nicholas Circuit Court, Mr Ricketts is an amiable, worthy and respected old man with a very large family, and has already been subjected to very great expense, on account of his unfortunate son, and it would be a great hardship to require him to pay this penalty, It would really be punishing him for an offence, which he never committed and which he abhors as much as any other person, His son wounded
Mr Still and ran off, but Mr Still has no objection to the remission of this Judgment and his brothers, I am informed, from their sympathy for the old man, have united in asking you to remit the judgment, I respectfully recommend that it be remitted,
